body: Your log doesn't contain any keyboard events at all. Is it a standard macOS IME?
Closing as duplicate of #458. I don't think there's any point in trying to track down more macOS keybinding issues considering we already know the fix for it will likely be the new keyboard API.
Do you think this might help with https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6827?

It was mentioned that `0.10.1` is also affected, but I've started breaking macOS input on regular basis since `0.11.0`.

Though, they could try to test `rc-2`(once it appear).

issue.title: Update glutin to 0.30.8 and winit to 0.28.6

body:
> Your log doesn't contain any keyboard events at all. Is it a standard macOS IME?

Yes, it is.

I tried to compile #6924. The problem still exists.

Keyboard events: 
[alacritty-0.12.1-rc1.log](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/11474888/alacritty-0.12.1-rc1.log)
[alacritty-0.13.0-dev.log](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/11474891/alacritty-0.13.0-dev.log)
Are you sure that you've compiled it correctly? Because I can't repro that bug anymore.
Yeah, looking at the log, you've compiled the wrong thing. Your hash doesn't match the one on the branch.

> Yeah, looking at the log, you've compiled the wrong thing. Your hash doesn't match the one on the branch.

It works. Thank you.
